Name: Pisco Bell Ringer
Ingredients: 5 ml De Kuyper Apricot Brandy liqueur
60 ml BarSol Mosto Verde Italia Pisco
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
2 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
Instructions: RINSE chilled glass with apricot brandy (swirl liqueur round inside of glass to coat and then shake out excess). SHAKE other ingredients with ice and fine strain into apricot rinsed glass.
Review: Go easy on the bitters and this will be a delicate, aromatic pisco cocktail.
History: Yet again I must thank drinks historian David Wondrich for unearthing this drink and its history. It was created by a bartender named Jim Maloney and first appeared in his 1903 book How to Mix Drinks . Maloney patented the name 'Bell-Ringers' as referring to cocktails served in glasses rinsed with apricot brandy.
Nutrition: One serving of Pisco Bell Ringer contains 131 calories
